lines.text: Oh, Willie, you've got to wake up. Other men are doing things, why can't you?
Well, what about our home? We've got a car and a radio and a vacuum cleaner.
There's a mortgage on - on the home! The vacuum cleaner's worn out and the car's practically a wreck!
The radio okay?
All in the world I want, Willie, is, is just one thing in my husband that I could brag about.
Now, you ought not keep a loaded gun around the house like this. You can never tell. It might have bullets in it.

[Talking on the phone]
In case you don't know it, you've committed a penal offense. Sure, we can send you to Sing-Sing!
What'd I tell ya. He's found his wallet and he's scared pink.
I kinda thought if I got in my pajamas, they wouldn't take me to jail.
Oh, here they are now. Oh, Judge, I'm so glad.
I had to go down to the picture show to get him.
Oh, it's Jean Harlow tonight, isn't it?
I robbed a man.
You what?
Stuck him up. Clipped him for two Gs.
I got a sort of a press clipping here.
Let's see it.
This fella says I got a spilt personality.
Oh, you mean a sissy.
Oh, no, it's a term used by Psychiatrists.
Hold on, Willie!
Millicent, dear, you simply mustn't let people see how badly you feel. Do brighten up.
Yes, Dorothy's right. Come on, cheer up, honey. Gay is the password!
I'm sorry, I meant to be gay.
Oh, forget it, Millie, forget it. Here try this.
[Offers her a cocktail]
The cup that cheers and turns all your woes into rosy nothings.
Is that the First Edition? Well, it's a hot story for the front page of New York newspaper! Holy jumpin' Moses, haven't we got anything better than that?
